name: Producer Pal
description: AI music production assistant for Ableton Live. Generate and edit MIDI clips, control playback, manage tracks, scenes, and the arrangement.
long_description:
To use: Add the Producer Pal device (Producer_Pal.amxd) to an empty MIDI track in Ableton Live. Ask Claude Desktop (with this extension enabled): "connect to ableton".
Requires Ableton Live 12.3+ with Max for Live (e.g. Ableton Live Suite).

mcp_server_origin.title: Ableton device URL
mcp_server_origin.description: URL for connecting to the Producer Pal Max for Live device (protocol://host:port). Use http://localhost:[port] for local connections or http://[IP]:[port] for network connections. The port number must match the port in the Max for Live device's advanced settings (default port is 3350). Restart this extension after changing the URL. Default: http://localhost:3350

enable_logging.title: Enable file logging
enable_logging.description: Enable logging to files. When disabled, no log files are created. Logging is disabled by default to avoid unnecessary file system writes.

verbose_logging.title: Enable verbose logging
verbose_logging.description: Enable detailed debug logging for troubleshooting. Shows request details, tool call arguments, and internal operations. Only has effect when file logging is enabled. Keep disabled for normal use.
